name: Twice-cooked Soy Sauce Chicken | Marion's Kitchen
description: Chicken drumsticks can be one of the more budget-friendly cuts of meat, but that doesn’t mean you’re scrimping on flavour. This very simple dish really does transform the humble into hero.
keywords: Appetisers, Best-ever chicken recipes, Chicken, Drumsticks, Eat with your hands, Family favourites
recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup spring onion, sliced into small batons
¼ cup Chinese Chinkiang black vinegar*
1 small cucumber, cut into bite-sized pieces

recipeInstructions.text: 2.Prepare the drumsticks by making 3-4 deep cuts into the meaty part of each piece. Place the chicken in a large bowl and add the marinade ingredients. Mix until well combined.
3.Line a baking tray with foil. Place the chicken pieces onto the foil in one layer. Pour over any marinade left in the bowl. Roast for 1 hour or until dark golden brown and just cooked through.

4.Just before the chicken drumsticks are ready, heat the vegetable oil in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, chilli and spring onion and stir-fry for a minute. Then add the vinegar, soy sauce and sugar. Simmer for 2-3 minutes.

5.Remove the drumsticks from the oven and transfer them into the pan with the sauce. Toss until well coated and simmer for another 3-4 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly and the chicken is sticky and glossy. Transfer to a serving bowl. Scatter over the cucumber and coriander.
Notes: – If you can’t find Chinese Chinkiang black vinegar you can substitute a mixture of half each white and balsamic vinegars.
